item.title: Drone Wars
item.description: Unseen, they stalk their targets from thousands of feet in the air. Operators are piloting them from military bases halfway across the world. At any moment, they could launch a strike that comes without warning. The attack drone was supposed to be a symbol of the era of precision warfare — a way to wage wars with fewer casualties on both sides. It's a technology that's been honed since it was first dreamed up during World War 1... Feed: https://feeds.npr.org/510333/podcast.xml

item.title: Scouting Five - Week of November 1, 2021
item.description:
Scouts head to COP26, Scout groups (always) need volunteers...and Scouts BSA introduces a new Merit Badge.News Stories
